meanings.definition: The end of life; the permanent cessation of all vital functions
meanings.sent1: After many years, the old tree finally faced death.
meanings.sent2: The family mourned the death of their beloved pet.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity almost led to its own death.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun painted the sky in hues of death.
meanings.sent5: In the winter, the garden was a place of death for the flowers.

meanings.sent1: The silence of death filled the abandoned house.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure seemed to embody death itself.
meanings.sent3: The zombie party was a hilarious take on death.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the cave felt like a cloak of death.
meanings.sent5: The graveyard was a chilling reminder of the finality of death.

meanings.definition: The act of dying; the end of life
meanings.sent1: The slow march towards death was inevitable.
meanings.sent2: The hero's sacrifice prevented the death of many.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit about death had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury was a dance with death for the sailors.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tolling bell signaled the coming of death.
